p: High levels of poor-neutralising prM antibodies are also found during secondary infection with in vitro ADE activity [ 65, 89]. Additionally, antibodies against NS1 are found during infection [ 65, 66, 95] and have been shown to enhance NS1â€²s complement activation activity and cross-react with platelets and endothelial cells. This may be an important contributor to vascular leakage and haemorrhaging [ 96, 97, 98, 99, 100], however, antibodies against NS1 have also been shown to reduce vascular leakage [ 77]. This may be explained by differences in the amounts or type of antibodies raised against NS1. A few antibodies have also been detected against other proteins, including non-structural [ 101, 102].
